object.course_desc: For students with no knowledge of Russian. Oral skills, reading and writing. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for RUSS1110.
Four hours a week.

object.course_desc: Continuation of first-year Russian. Oral skills, reading and writing. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for RUSS1110.
Prerequisite(s): grade of C or higher in RUSS1010, or permission of the School.
Four hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: grade of C or higher in RUSS1010, or permission of the School.

object.course_desc: For students with no knowledge of Russian. Oral skills, reading and writing. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for RUSS1010 and RUSS1020.
 Eight hours a week (one term).

object.course_desc: Further study of Russian to reach a more advanced level of proficiency in a range of situations. Equal emphasis on oral and written language. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): grade of C or higher in RUSS1020 or RUSS1110, or permission of the School.
Four hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: grade of C or higher in RUSS1020 or RUSS1110, or permission of the School.

object.course_desc: Continuation of second-year Russian. Further study of Russian to reach a more advanced level of proficiency in a range of situations. Equal emphasis on oral and written language. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): grade of C or higher in RUSS2010, or permission of the School.
Four hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: grade of C or higher in RUSS2010, or permission of the School.

object.course_desc: Further study of Russian to reach a more advanced level, including the ability to handle authentic materials and primary texts required for academic studies. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): grade of C or higher in RUSS2020, or permission of the School.
Three hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: grade of C or higher in RUSS2020, or permission of the School.

object.course_desc: For students who have attained Russian language proficiency in informal settings or who completed elementary school in a Russian speaking country. The course builds literacy skills, formalizes grammar awareness, and develops writing and reading language skills in a formal academic setting.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for all 1000 through 3000 level Russian courses.
Prerequisite(s): Permission of the School.
Online.

object.course_desc: Continuation of third-year Russian. Progress toward a more advanced level, including the ability to handle authentic materials and primary texts required for academic studies. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): grade of C or higher in RUSS3010, or permission of the School.
Three hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: grade of C or higher in RUSS3010, or permission of the School.

object.course_desc: Further study of Russian to enhance students’ literacy skills and formalize grammar awareness in a formal academic setting. Emphasis on the use of formal and academic language in oral and written form; further development of writing and reading skills.
object.course_extra_details:
Precludes additional credit for all 1000 through 3000 level Russian courses.
Prerequisite(s): RUSS3015 or permission of the School.
Online.
object.course_prerequisites: RUSS3015 or permission of the School.

object.course_desc: Advanced spoken and written Russian with intensive practice in aural comprehension and speaking in a range of situations and contexts, in reading and in composition in a range of modes and genres. Metalinguistic study. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): grade of C or higher in RUSS3020, or permission of the School.
Three hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: grade of C or higher in RUSS3020, or permission of the School.

object.course_desc: Continuation of fourth-year Russian. Advanced spoken and written Russian with intensive practice in aural comprehension and speaking in a range of situations and contexts, in reading and in composition in a range of modes and genres. Metalinguistic study. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Prerequisite(s): grade of C or higher in RUSS4010, or permission of the School.
Three hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: grade of C or higher in RUSS4010, or permission of the School.

object.course_desc: Russian language skills for translation of modern history and social science texts from Russian into English, with an emphasis on syntax. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Precludes additional credit for Russian translation offered under EURR4901.
Prerequisite(s): permission of the School. Not open to students with native-like Russian proficiency.
Three hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: permission of the School. Not open to students with native-like Russian proficiency.

object.course_desc: Russian language skills for conducting research in modern history and social sciences, with an emphasis on practice and theory of translation from Russian into English. Compulsory attendance.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Precludes additional credit for Russian translation offered under EURR4902.
Prerequisite(s): grade of C in RUSS4115, or permission of the School. Not open to students with native-like Russian proficiency.
Three hours a week.
object.course_prerequisites: grade of C in RUSS4115, or permission of the School. Not open to students with native-like Russian proficiency.

object.course_desc: Research in a topic in Russian language, literature or linguistics under the supervision of a member of the School.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Prerequisite(s): third- or fourth-year standing and enrolment in the Minor in Russian, grade of C or higher in RUSS3020 or equivalent, or permission of the School.
object.course_prerequisites: third- or fourth-year standing and enrolment in the Minor in Russian, grade of C or higher in RUSS3020 or equivalent, or permission of the School.

object.course_desc: Research in a topic in Russian language, literature or linguistics under the supervision of a member of the School.
object.course_extra_details:
Includes: Experiential Learning Activity
Prerequisite(s): third- or fourth-year standing and enrolment in the Minor in Russian, grade of C or higher in RUSS3020, or equivalent, or permission of the School.
object.course_prerequisites: third- or fourth-year standing and enrolment in the Minor in Russian, grade of C or higher in RUSS3020, or equivalent, or permission of the School.
